excerpt: Vibrant, colorful venue with outdoor dining serving inventive Puerto Rican dishes & craft cocktails.
detail_description: Casita Miramar is a vibrant and colorful restaurant located in the lively Miramar district of San Juan. Housed in a charming Spanish villa, the venue offers a warm and inviting atmosphere with cozy decor, including hanging plants, twinkle lights, and vintage furniture. The outdoor dining area is adorned with lush greenery, creating a relaxed ambiance for enjoying inventive Puerto Rican dishes and craft cocktails.
name: Casita Miramar
address: 605 Av. Miramar, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Relaxed eatery offering a breakfast & brunch menu with chocolate used in every dish.
detail_description: Chocobar Cortés is a cocoa-focused cafe located in Old San Juan, offering a unique dining experience with chocolate-infused dishes for breakfast and brunch. The establishment is an extension of the fourth-generation chocolate-making operation, Chocolate Cortes, which has been producing locally and sustainably grown cacao varieties since 1929. The menu at Chocobar Cortés features a variety of sweet and savory dishes that incorporate chocolate into every bite.
name: Chocobar Cortés
address: 210 C. de San Francisco, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Nestled in Old San Juan, La Casita Blanca is a charming restaurant that has been serving both locals and tourists for over 40 years. The name "Little White House" perfectly captures the simplicity of this place, with its potted plants, plastic tablecloths, and old rum bottles used as vases. The menu is exclusively in Spanish and is handwritten on a weathered chalkboard. Upon arrival, guests are greeted with complimentary codfish fritters and plantain soup.
name: La Casita Blanca
address: 351 C. Tapia, San Juan, 00912, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Chic restaurant serving tapas, mains & creative cocktails in an industrial-style space.
detail_description: Santaella is a stylish restaurant located in Santurce, offering a blend of tapas, main dishes, and innovative cocktails within an industrial-style space. The dining room overlooks an interior garden and features a contemporary design. Chef Jose Santaella brings his expertise from working with renowned names like Ferran Adria and Eric Ripert to create upscale market-driven cocina criolla. Guests can enjoy this elevated local cuisine for lunch at affordable prices or visit in the evening for cocktails and small plates.
name: Santaella
address: 219 C. Canals, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Stylish restaurant featuring an international menu with creative plates, plus cocktails & wine.
detail_description: Marmalade is a stylish restaurant in San Juan known for its international menu and creative dishes. Chef Peter Schintler has crafted an ingredient-driven menu that combines local flavors with global influences, featuring dishes like ceviche paired with tostones and vegan poblanos rellenos atop spicy black beans and mole. The restaurant offers tasting menus ranging from five to 14 courses, with the option of a plant-based menu.
name: Marmalade
address: 317 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Vianda, located in Santurce, is a trendy restaurant founded by former NYC chef Francis Guzman and his wife, Amelia Dill. The stylish wood-paneled bar draws a diverse crowd of visitors and regulars for early evening cocktails. The farm-to-table menu showcases the island's culinary heritage with dishes like sourdough tostadas and raices locales. The restaurant's laid-back vibe features friendly service and minimalist decor with white walls and hanging plants.
name: Vianda
address: 1413 PR-25, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Laid-back coffee shop offering locally roasted espresso, cafe meals & pastries, plus patio seating.
detail_description: Café Cuatro Sombras is a trendy coffee shop located in the heart of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It stands out for offering locally grown and roasted coffee beans, providing a strong yet not bitter flavor. The café is the face of the owner's family coffee plantation, Hacienda Santa Clara, which was established in 1846 in the mountains of Yauco.
name: Café Cuatro Sombras
address: 259 C. Recinto Sur, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Located in the vibrant foodie spot of La Placita in Santurce, San Juan, La Alcapurria Quema is a casual eatery offering a taste of authentic Puerto Rican comfort food. The restaurant is situated near Ocean Park and Condado, making it a convenient stop for locals and tourists alike.
name: La Alcapurria Quemá
address: 251 C. Duffaut, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Kasalta is a beloved bakery and diner located in Ocean Park, known for its diverse offerings beyond just pastries. The establishment has two sides; one serving Spanish-inspired dishes like tapas, paella, and hearty soups, while the other offers Cuban sandwiches, soups, pastries, and desserts. Visitors can also purchase Spanish staples such as olives, Manchego cheese, and Serrano ham.
name: Kasalta
address: 1966 Av. McLeary, San Juan, 00911, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Bodega Chic, located at 51 Calle del Cristo in Old San Juan, offers a relaxed and unpretentious atmosphere with amazing French cuisine infused with Mediterranean and Caribbean influences. The decor exudes a bohemian vibe reminiscent of the area's past. It's known for its simple yet delicious food, making it a gem for brunch on Sundays. In the evening, Bodega Chic transforms into a hip lounge where guests can enjoy great food and drinks.
name: Bodega Chic
address: 313 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: La Casita Del Chef Javier is a delightful restaurant with a surprising and delicious menu. The churrasco is tender, perfectly cooked, and well-seasoned. The portion sizes are satisfying, and the flavors are amazing. The service is attentive, although there were some minor issues with timing and food presentation. Despite this, the overall experience is outstanding. The environment is spacious and beautiful, offering a great place to enjoy the fantastic food and strong, tasty drinks.
name: La Casita Restaurant by Chef Javier
address: Coabey, Jayuya 00664, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Cosmopolitan restaurant serving innovative tasting menus, wine pairings & cocktails.
detail_description: Cocina Abierta, which translates to "open kitchen," is a cosmopolitan restaurant in San Juan led by Argentine chef Martin Louzao. The restaurant offers innovative tasting menus with wine pairings and cocktails, emphasizing pan-Latin cuisine with influences from the Caribbean to the Mediterranean. What sets Cocina Abierta apart is its interactive experience for diners, as it features an open kitchen where guests can watch the talented kitchen staff prepare diverse creations.
name: Cocina Abierta
address: 58 Caribe St, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: La Estación is a unique dining spot located in an old gas station outside the Conquistador Resort in Fajardo, Puerto Rico. The restaurant is the brainchild of two New Yorkers with extensive restaurant experience who have brought their expertise to create a culinary haven dedicated to Nuyorican BBQ. This innovative style combines American barbecue techniques with Caribbean flavors and spices, resulting in mouthwatering dishes that are not to be missed.
name: La Estación
address: Fajardo, 00738, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Aguas Buenas, El Rancho de Apa offers a genuine taste of Puerto Rican culture and cuisine. This charming lechonera features cinder block roasting pits where they prepare succulent pork seasoned with a unique blend of spices, including salt, garlic, and adobo. A visit here is essential for anyone wanting to savor traditional dishes like lechon and arroz con gandules—roasted pig served alongside rice and pigeon peas.
name: El Rancho de Apa
address: Carr. 173 KM 28.9 Bo, Guaynabo 00927, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Cozy cafe featuring house-roasted local beans, pour-overs, light fare & displays on coffee-making.
detail_description: Don Ruiz Coffee is a charming cafe nestled in the historic courtyard of the former military Ballaja Barracks, now housing various cultural and educational organizations. The cafe offers a delightful selection of house-roasted local beans, pour-overs, and light fare. The 100% Arabica beans are sourced from the Ruiz family farm in Yauco, known for its rich and robust flavors.
name: Don Ruiz Coffee
address: Cuartel de Ballaja, Calle Norzagaray Esq. Beneficiencia, San Juan, PR 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: La Mallorquina, located on Calle San Justo 207, is a historic restaurant that has been around for over 170 years. The recent renovations have given it a beautiful atmosphere with polished floors and old mirrors dating back over 175 years. The staff is friendly and the non-alcoholic mojitos are highly recommended. The seafood variety, including shellfish and red snapper in a rice and tomato stew, is delicious.
name: La Mallorquina
address: 207 C. de San Justo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Santurce, Sur Barra Nikkei is a culinary gem that beautifully intertwines the rich flavors of Peruvian and Japanese cuisines. This innovative restaurant, led by Chef Rafael Ubior Serrati, offers an inviting atmosphere where each dish tells a story of cultural fusion. Diners can expect delightful surprises like zesty Peruvian sauces enhancing delicate sashimi or creative uses of wasabi in traditional Latin fare.
name: Sur Barra Nikkei
address: 411 C. del Parque, Santurce, San Juan 00909, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Intimate eatery featuring elevated French cuisine & fine wines in a dimly lit, romantic atmosphere.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Old San Juan, Trois Cent Onze is an intimate and upscale French restaurant that offers a sophisticated dining experience. The restaurant boasts an elegant decor, excellent service, and a superb wine list. With its colorful Moorish-Andalucian gateway entrance, the dining room exudes sophistication and intimacy. Chef Carlos Guzman Tavarez's delicate and flavorful classic French cuisine is complemented by a well-stocked wine cellar.
name: Trois Cent Onze
address: 311 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: La Bombonera, located on San Francisco Street in Old San Juan, is a charming bakery and cafe that has been serving delicious coffee and baked goods for over 50 years. The iconic cafe recently underwent major building renovations, making it an even more beautiful location to enjoy their amazing coffee. One of the must-try items at La Bombonera is the Mallorca, a sweet roll filled with your choice of ingredients and pressed until warm and crisp, then dusted with powdered sugar.
name: La Bombonera
address: 259 Viejo, C. de San Francisco, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Lively gathering place with cafes & kiosks offering fast food, plus terrace seating.
detail_description: Lote 23, located in Santurce, is a vibrant food park and community center that opened in late 2016. It offers a variety of dining options from kiosks and Airstream trailers, serving everything from hearty plates of pernil to light poke bowls and handmade popsicles. The park also hosts events like yoga sessions, film screenings, and artisan markets.
name: Lote 23
address: 1552 PR-25, San Juan, 00909, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Verde Mesa is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Old San Juan. The cozy and rustic ambiance, with pressed-tin ceilings and vintage furniture, sets the stage for a delightful dining experience. The menu features superb Mediterranean-Caribbean fusion cuisine, with a focus on using indigenous tropical ingredients and fresh local produce. Vegetarian-friendly options are plentiful and inventive, such as the refreshing ceviche-style chayote salad and hearty pumpkin and barley porridge.
name: Verde Mesa
address: 107 Calle Tetuan Esq, C. de San José, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Located in the southern section of Old San Juan, Señor Paleta is a small family-owned shop that has gained popularity for its handcrafted paletas. These refreshing natural popsicles come in a variety of flavors, including both milk and fruit-based options. The shop offers dairy and non-dairy choices, with flavors ranging from chocolate to various tropical fruits. Despite its size, Señor Paleta attracts eager customers who happily wait in line to indulge in these cold treats.
name: Señor Paleta
address: 153 C. Tetuán, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Bananas is a popular spot in Esperanza, offering a relaxed atmosphere with playful rain-forest murals and teal-colored tables. The menu features dishes like red snapper sandwich, jerk chicken, and Caribbean salads. The highlight is the deep-fried bananas with hot honey sauce. With an airy timber-built venue overlooking the ocean, it's an ideal place to enjoy island living vibes while sipping on tropical cocktails like pina coladas and mojitos.
name: Bananas Beach Bar and Guesthouse
address: 142 Calle Flamboyan, Esperanza, Vieques 00765, Puerto Rico

detail_description: El Quenepo in Esperanza, Vieques is a well-respected restaurant known for its elegant dining experience. Located on the waterfront Malecon, it offers a touch of class with linen-dressed tables and gorgeous decor without being pretentious. Many consider it the most romantic restaurant on the island, with open arches allowing a continuous sea breeze and an upstairs balcony for additional seating options.
name: El Quenepo Vieques
address: 148 Calle Flamboyan, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Renowned rum distillery featuring historical tours, mixology classes, tastings & an outdoor patio.
detail_description: Nestled just outside San Juan in Catano, Casa BACARDÍ is a must-visit for anyone exploring Puerto Rico. This iconic rum distillery offers an engaging experience that combines history and mixology. Visitors can embark on a fascinating tour through the new visitor center, where stunning views of the harbor and Old San Juan await. The journey delves into the rich heritage of sugar cane cultivation in the Caribbean and reveals how rum production began on these vibrant islands.
name: Casa BACARDÍ
address: 200 PR-165, Cataño, 00962, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Airy apartments with kitchens in a relaxed pick with sea views, an outdoor pool & full breakfast.
detail_description: Perched on a hilltop in Rincon, The English Rose has been a beloved establishment for over 15 years. This airy and white hotel offers just five rooms with doors that open to stunning ocean views. The property is adorned with beautiful feature walls filled with flowers and local plant life, as well as furnishings from local artisans. Guests can enjoy the sparkling infinity pool and a fantastic restaurant offering local, English, and American dishes.
name: The English Rose
address: 413 Carretera Bo, Rincón, 00677, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Streamlined quarters in a relaxed hotel offering a casino, an outdoor pool & a restaurant.
detail_description: Holiday Inn Mayaguez & Tropical Casino, an IHG Hotel, offers comfortable and clean accommodations with everything needed to stay connected. The hotel features a casino, outdoor pool, and a restaurant serving traditional Puerto Rican cuisine. Guests praise the courteous staff and well-maintained premises. Families appreciate the included breakfast and clean facilities. The hotel's customer service, COVID restrictions, cleanliness, and exquisite food are highly praised by visitors who plan on returning for their next stay in Mayaguez.
name: Holiday Inn Mayaguez & Tropical Casino, an IHG Hotel
address: 2701 PR-2, Mayagüez, 00680, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Cayo Caribe is a popular eatery in Puerto Rico known for its creole and seafood dishes. The restaurant offers a variety of flavorful options such as mofongo with lobster, mahi mahi tacos, arroz mamposteao, and chuletas (pork chops), showcasing the best of home-cooked Puerto Rican cuisine. While some visitors appreciate the affordable prices and excellent service, others note that the atmosphere has a sports bar vibe.
name: Cayo Caribe
address: 253 Avenida F.D. Roosevelt, San Juan, 00918, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Salitre Mesón Costero is a charming seaside restaurant located on the northern coast of the island near Arecibo. The outdoor seating offers stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean, creating a romantic and laid-back atmosphere. The menu features local seafood, rice dishes, and Puerto Rican specialties like mofongo. Visitors can savor dishes such as smokey grilled octopus and an array of fish and seafood options.
name: Salitre Mesón Costero
address: Km. 3.8, PR-681, Arecibo, 00612, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Cocktails & classic bar bites dished up in a vibrant hangout with a rustic-chic vibe.
detail_description: La Factoría is a vibrant hangout with a rustic-chic vibe that has gained international acclaim for its excellent cocktails and classic bar bites. It's a local favorite in Puerto Rico, known for introducing mixology to the island. The bar consists of four different spaces, each with its own theme, including a room filled with rum-fueled dancers and a DJ playing until late. The middle space features old-school salsa music and boasts one of the best dance floors on the island.
name: La Factoría
address: 51 C. de San José, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Pirilo Pizza Rustica in Old San Juan is a must-visit spot for pizza enthusiasts. The restaurant offers a wide variety of creative pizza toppings and even features a cuatro leches cake on the menu. What sets this place apart is its second-floor seating area, which exudes a different ambiance with dark wood furnishings, vintage photographs, and high-backed seating.
name: Pirilo Pizza Rustica - Old San Juan
address: 207 Ca. de la Tanca, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: The Coffee Museum of Puerto Rico, also known as Museo del Cafe de Puerto Rico, offers a captivating journey through the island's rich coffee-making heritage. Visitors can explore antique mills, vintage coffee bags, and historical records that chronicle the evolution of coffee production in Puerto Rico. The museum is not only a treasure trove of coffee-related artifacts but also serves as a working facility where Pedro Maldonado Ramirez and his family roast, package, and distribute their renowned Cafe Don Pello coffee.
name: Coffee Museum of Puerto Rico
address: 42 Calle Palmer, Ciales, 00638, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Hacienda Muñoz, located just a 30-minute drive from Old San Juan in rural San Lorenzo, offers visitors a chance to immerse themselves in the beauty of Puerto Rico's coffee country. The plantation provides walking tours that delve into the island's rich coffee history and modern cultivation techniques. The tour culminates with a tasting of Hacienda Muñoz's specialty coffee.
name: Hacienda Muñoz
address: 627Q+54W, PR-181, San Lorenzo, 00754, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Bustling destination serving upscale Puerto Rican cuisine envisioned by a celebrated chef.
detail_description: Jose Enrique is an upscale Puerto Rican restaurant located in Condado, San Juan, envisioned by the celebrated chef Jose Enrique. The restaurant is situated in La Placita de Santurce, a lively area that transforms from a farmers market during the day to a vibrant street party at night. Jose Enrique, who hails from Santurce and is renowned for his innovative culinary skills, has been recognized as one of the best chefs in America.
name: Jose Enrique Puerto Rican restaurant
address: 1021 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Nestled in the lively Santurce neighborhood, Cocina al Fondo, which translates to "kitchen in the back," is a captivating culinary gem that pays homage to Puerto Rican traditions and flavors. Embracing a circular system concept, it champions sustainability while showcasing the island's rich history through meticulously crafted dishes. The restaurant supports local agriculture by sourcing ingredients from nearby farmers and fishermen as well as its own garden.
name: Cocina al Fondo
address: 658 C. San Juan, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: JungleBird is a cozy tiki bar located on the edge of La Placita in San Juan, known for its Taino-tropical drinks and imaginative bar food. The bartenders at Jungle Bird put a modern twist on the classic Pina Colada by combining tepache with Don Q Oro and coconut cream to create the Tepache Colada.
name: JungleBird
address: 254 C. Canals, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Traditional indoor-outdoor venue serving Puerto Rican specialties & familiar international cuisine.
detail_description: Barrachina is a historic indoor-outdoor venue located in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It is renowned as the birthplace of the world-famous Pina Colada, which was created by Don Ramon Portas Mingot in its magnificent courtyard back in 1963. The restaurant offers a diverse menu featuring Spanish, Puerto Rican, and international dishes that cater to every palate. Whether you're craving traditional local specialties or familiar international cuisine, Barrachina has something wonderful for everyone.
name: Barrachina
address: 104 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: The puerto rican restaurant Ropa Vieja Grill is a highly recommendable and amazing place with renowned chefs. The food here is flavorful Caribbean food served in an elegant and colorful way. The outdoor seating is great if you like to people watch.
name: Ropa Vieja Grill
address: 55 Avenida Condado Esq, Av. Ashford, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Caficultura, located in the heart of Old San Juan, is a charming cafe known for its trendy and popular all-day breakfast and brunch menu. The cafe offers a variety of delicious gourmet sandwiches, hearty dishes, and numerous vegetarian options. The building itself is beautifully restored with distressed concrete walls meeting an old Spanish-style wood-beamed ceiling adorned with a magnificent antique chandelier. Visitors can enjoy farm-to-table food and delightful coffee drinks made from beans sourced directly from Puerto Rican farms.
name: Caficultura
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Relaxed beachside guesthouse featuring modern rooms, an outdoor pool & an informal restaurant.
detail_description: Located in the Ocean Park area of San Juan, Numero Uno Beach Hotel & Restaurant is a relaxed beachside guesthouse with modern rooms, an outdoor pool, and an informal restaurant. The whitewashed bar and kitchen offer a cool spot to enjoy Ocean Lab Brewing Co beers or chilled cocktails on the shaded terrace or under big blue umbrellas right on the sand. It's also a great place to watch kiteboarders and even take kiteboarding lessons.
name: Numero Uno Beach House
address: 1 C. Sta. Ana, San Juan, 00911, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Café Regina is a contemporary coffee shop in Puerto Rico that offers a unique experience for coffee enthusiasts. The owner, Kali Solack, incorporates the rich flavors of Puerto Rican agriculture into their offerings, such as turmeric tea with fresh pineapple juice and locally made sourdough topped with fresh ricotta and star fruit jam. The café is known for its experimental coffee creations like Coffee with tonic and the popular Dark N Stormy, a cold-brewed coconut syrup and ginger beer concoction.
name: Café Regina
address: 1705 Calle la Loiza Esquina, C. Taft, San Juan, 00911, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Que PezCa'o is a casual seafood restaurant located near the harbor in Puerto Rico. The restaurant spills out onto a covered alfresco seating area, where guests can relax and enjoy mellow live music. The menu features fresh-off-the-boat fish dishes that are often inventive takes on traditional dishes.
name: Qué PezCa'o
address: Final Villa Pesquera del Parque Central, Calle Cerra, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vieques, Tin Box Vieques Restaurant and Bar is a must-visit spot for anyone looking to refuel after a day soaking up the sun. This charming eatery boasts an inviting atmosphere and exceptional service, making it perfect for beachgoers. The menu is a delightful mix of fresh seafood, BBQ chicken and pork, flavorful fish tacos, juicy steaks with homemade fries, and even sushi options that highlight local ingredients like spiny lobster.
name: Tin Box Vieques Restaurant and Bar
address: Route 996 & 201, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Pasion por el Fogon is a popular upscale restaurant located near Playa Sardinera in Fajardo, Puerto Rico. Known for its diverse menu, the restaurant offers a variety of dishes including gluten-free, vegan, vegetarian, contemporary, Spanish, international, seafood, Latin, Caribbean and Puerto Rican cuisine. The elegant atmosphere makes it an ideal choice for a romantic dinner or a relaxing night out.
name: Pasion por el Fogon
address: PR-987, Fajardo, 00738, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Classic local dishes, spirits & a rum list are served in this woodsy restaurant that has a patio.
detail_description: Princesa - Cocina Cultura, formerly known as Princesa Gastrobar, is a charming restaurant located in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. Situated on the harbor side near the historic Old Spanish Arsenal piers and surrounded by lush tropical plants, this woodsy eatery offers classic local dishes and an extensive rum list. The outdoor seating area under an open trellis-style ceiling creates a cool ambiance for diners to enjoy elevated Puerto Rican cuisine.
name: Princesa - Cocina Cultura
address: 2 Paseo De La Princesa, Calle Shurmberg, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Acapulco Taquería Mexicana is a casual eatery with an open kitchen where you can watch the preparation of their signature al pastor pork. The restaurant prides itself on serving authentic Mexican cuisine, eschewing Tex-Mex fare in favor of dishes like al pastor and lengua tacos, cochinita sopes, and more. Despite its unassuming location behind a pawn shop, this spot is known for some of the best Mexican food in Puerto Rico.
name: Acapulco Taquería Mexicana
address: 2021 C. Loíza, San Juan, 00911, Puerto Rico

name: Aviones
address: Carr. 143, Km. 57.0 Bo, 00784, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Upscale eatery with New American fare, an extensive wine list & large windows providing ocean views.
detail_description: 1919 Restaurant is an upscale dining establishment located in the luxurious Condado Vanderbilt Hotel, offering stunning ocean views and high-quality New American cuisine. The menu features traditional Puerto Rican dishes with a modern twist, using locally sourced ingredients that change seasonally. Helmed by Michelin-star chef Juan Jose Cuevas, the restaurant offers sophisticated dishes like braised veal crispy grain salad and coconut ganache.
name: 1919 Restaurant
address: 1055 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Casual Caribbean eatery featuring a full bar, a sizable wine list & contemporary decor.
detail_description: Metropol Restaurant in the Sheraton Hotel Convention Center District is a casual Caribbean eatery with contemporary decor and a full bar. It's known for its Cuban-inspired food and large portions at reasonable prices. The restaurant is family-friendly, slightly crowded, but offers attentive service with waiters available to assist guests. Customers praise the delicious food, particularly the 'Fiesta Cubana' sampler plate, and recommend trying the Tres Leches dessert.
name: Metropol Restaurant - Sheraton Hotel Convention Center District
address: Hotel Sheraton 200 Convention P.R, Bv. Román Baldorioty de Castro, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: La Marqueta is a restaurant that consists of four locations, each with a unique menu. The restaurants are named Jose Enrique, ECUME, Taqueria La Sirena and Shogun Cuisine, which brings different flavors from all over the world into one space. There's also a variety of food and drinks menus to make for an interesting chinchorreo.
name: La Marqueta
address: 1005 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
